subject: Philosophy
title: Moral Luck
description: A fast breakdown of Moral Luck for builders.

hook.text: Two drivers text while driving. One arrives safely. The other hits a child. Same action, different blame.

buildup.text: Thomas Nagel called this 'moral luck' ‚Äî factors beyond your control affecting your moral standing.

discovery.text: We judge the unlucky driver far more harshly, even though both took the same reckless risk.

twist.text: It goes deeper. Your upbringing, genes, and circumstances shape your character ‚Äî and you didn't choose those.

climax.text: If so much of morality depends on luck, can we fairly praise or blame anyone for anything?

punchline.text: Luck shouldn't matter morally. But it does.

quiz.question: What did Thomas Nagel mean by 'moral luck'?
options: Uncontrollable factors that affect moral judgment
Being born into a good family
Winning the lottery and donating it
